Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is a blatantly biased article by a paid shill. dPoW is battle tested and proven. Also, when a coin will be updating their source code, it is a good thing that the two dev teams are coordinating to make sure things go smoothly. if that is called centralization, it seems it is unavoidable. We do have to charge a nominal fee to cover expenses, but we dont require anybody to pay for the BTC txfees, nor for a coin to change their emission schedule to payout a percentage, nor do we spam the BTC chain 500x with the same data with something that likely cant differentiate from the attacker chain vs. the real chain. and of course no coin actually uses this now, so all the BTC spam is just $1.5 mil per month being wasted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
it is not clear if even VBK is using the data on the BTC chain at this point. As it is closed source there is no way to know. We do know that aggregating data from random nodes on the internet wont create any trustless data. that just doesnt work as the attacker can just buy the winning chain, if chains actually used the PoP data, it would help the attacker double spend. so they have many problems left to solve. 

dPoW has already solved all this, it is effective, cost efficient, open source. It just makes me sad that people can post blatant lies about our tech

Author: Iurii#4844
Content: Hi all. Just trying to contribute to Komodo. This is my medium article with a proposal for the improvement of Komodo platform and ecosystem in order to facilitate community activity in this field and give some inspiration to the team. https://medium.com/@shafkupe/improvement-proposals-for-komodo-blockchain-ecosystem-9f42952a191b

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
1. already half a dozen external projects have dPoW and over 500 coins integrated into barterDEX. it seems this is well underway
2. agreed and we have projects in the works to solve this
3. the pegs CC will utilize KMD as backing to create stablecoins, but in general I prefer to just expand the ecosystem and KMD benefits indirectly. Artificially constraining supply, is pretty artificial and charging fees in KMD just because we can will slow down adoption.
4. the design of CC is such that each one creates its own set of rpc calls, so just by calling various rpc calls (in any language) you can create a dapp, this is much easier than even writing interpreted smart contracts
5. LN could work with blockchain protocol that doesnt have txid malleability, but they made it also require segwit. KMD will never have segwit. That being said channels CC solves the latency issue for payments and creates a hubless (no centralization) payment channels
6. as you say we are working with projects to integrate in all directions, gaming included
7. last time i checked, we have no way to force the community to do anything, but of course any community help is appreciated

thanks for your article, it seems most is covered but always we can use more help in the areas that we are not full covered in

Author: Iurii#4844
Content: Thank for your response!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think when people realize 4. above and that just by issuing rpc calls they can create powerful dapps, we will see a lot more devs building things. we are actively working to enhance the documentation in this area

Author: Iurii#4844
Content:
Maybe my problem is that I can't imagine that RPC calls may be flexible enough for the implementation of complex business logic which we have in projects of my company. We use blockchains and have to implement some kind of smart contracts service based on multisig to handle our business logic in a decentralized manner when used blockchain itself has RPC API. 
So it is really mind-blowing design of RPC if it will handle all possible cases. Other possible interpretation is that API is designed to make possible integration of decentralized services which will emulate some kind of smart contracts. Then it is possible to design service templates to handle flexible business logic using RPC by the community developers.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: CHIPS uses a modified LN that uses CHIPS instead of BTC and only in a hub and spoke network to avoid all the routing issues

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Is there only one hub or several in network ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the network might spontaneously connect out, but the dealer is the hub and the players are the spokes for each table

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which are managed independently

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Thank you. Cross-tables makes no sense now

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in LN the sender/receiver needed to specify the path. I didnt see how to do that in any reasonable way

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but I only needed a hub and spoke

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
I understand, so we'll have less LN possible problems and questions about network, scaling, channels, hops and inbound/outbound balances of each channel.
The path (route) finding was optimized in each LN implementation. Now, you can still specify the path but in 99% of cases, you don't specify any it will find the best path (route) with the less routing fees. I used only testnet and with 2 or 3 channels, I had no problems during months but I heard that some ppl had unbalanced channels after few payments and were not happy (mainly with beta mobile wallets without some features)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in small networks wont have much problems

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: when you get to half a dozen or more required hops...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is an always changing problem, seems impossible to make anything optimal, traveling salesmans type of problem with always changing values.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe it is possible to get things working most of the time, but there is that trust point for the very small amounts which seems a pretty big problem

Author: phm87#7395
Content: With a direct path (route), on BTC testnet, I was able to send 1 satoshi (pay an invoice of 1 sat) with few millisatoshis of fee. (I knew the guy on the other side and we configured it to accept that ... we heard we can also exchange with 0 fees) I'd like to test and measure it with a satoshi of CHIPS
